roleset.name: prevent an action, forbidding
roleset.note: PROHIBIT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'prohibit' based on sentences in financial subcorpus; adjectival 'prohibitive' based on BOLT-4,5. VN class forbid-67. Comparison with 'ban' and 'stop'. (from prohibit.01-v)
PROHIBITION-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT, prohibit-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls forbid-67. (from prohibition.01-n)
PROHIBITIVE-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from prohibitive.01-j)

example.name: prohibit-v: typical usage
example.text: Gulf Power had been under investigation for violating the Utility Holding Company Act, which *trace* prohibits public utilities from making political contributions.
example.arg: which -> the Utility Holding Company Act

example.name: prohibit-v: just transitive
example.text: John's criminal record prohibits his getting a productive job, so he works on the PAS project.

example.name: prohibit-v: with instrument
example.text: Mary prohibits John from getting a decent night's sleep with her relentless nagging.
example.arg: from getting a decent night's sleep

example.name: prohibition-n: just arg1
example.text: These drug killings are no different than Al Capone killing people during alcohol prohibition .

example.name: prohibition-n: args 1 and 2
example.text: Their prohibition from enjoying further credit services will continue until such a time when they full repay all agreed outstandings to AMCON.

example.name: prohibitive-j: Legally prohibitive
example.text: My argument is that the law is prohibitive of free speech..

roleset.name: excessively high or likely so as to discourage another action
roleset.note: PROHIBITIVE-J NOTES: adjectival 'prohibitive' based on BOLT-4,5. Importantly, in this sense, 'prohibitive' indicates discouragement, but not necessarily forbidding. Prohibitive laws and measures, which actually forbid an action legally, should be treated as prohibit.01

role.descr: Attribute of Arg0 that discourages, when separate

example.name: prohibitive-j
example.text: Last time we got a thread like this , I suggested Tiuta and the OP did some research and found the cost was prohibitive .

example.name: prohibitive-j: Prohibitive favorite
example.text: He is the prohibitive favorite to win the nomination.

example.name: prohibitive-j: Prohibitive with Arg2
example.text: Fireproof construction is prohibitive in cost.

example.name: prohibitive-j: Prohibitive with Arg1 person
example.text: The cost of the technology is prohibitive to dabblers, hobbyists.

example.name: prohibitive-j: Prohibitive with Arg1 action
example.text: In the event that the cost is prohibitive to your attendance...
